alert.note: Alert for Central Douglas County; Eastern Curry County and Josephine County; Eastern Douglas County Foothills; Jackson County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 07 at 3:45AM PST until December 08 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 10 PM PST THURSDAY ABOVE 2500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches expected above 2500 feet. Higher amounts possible at elevations above 4000 feet, especially in the Coast Range. * WHERE...Douglas County, Eastern Curry County and Josephine County, and Jackson County. * WHEN...From 10 PM Wednesday to 10 PM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult due to reduced visibility from blowing snow and slick roads. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The period of heaviest snowfall will be between 10 AM through 4 PM PST Thursday. There is a 10% chance snowfall rates reach one inch per hour. During periods of lighter snowfall intensity, roads could end up wet during the day Thursday. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow could cause travel difficulties.

area.areaDesc: Central Douglas County; Eastern Curry County and Josephine County; Eastern Douglas County Foothills; Jackson County
